title: Neville Brody
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20141101125053/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices): [Designers](http://web.archive.org/web/20141101125053/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Designers): Neville Brody**

**Neville Brody** (b. 1957) is a London born graphic designer. Studied at the [London College of Printing](http://web.archive.org/web/20141101125053/http:/typophile.com/wiki/London%20College%20of%20Printing). Primarily known for his work as Art Director on _The Face_ magazine and for his studio's work on the late 1990s [Macromedia](http://web.archive.org/web/20141101125053/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Macromedia) identity. In 1990 he and [Erik Spiekermann](http://web.archive.org/web/20141101125053/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Erik%20Spiekermann) started [FontFont](http://web.archive.org/web/20141101125053/http:/typophile.com/wiki/FontFont) and _[Fuse](http://web.archive.org/web/20141101125053/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Fuse)_. Currently he operates his [London](http://web.archive.org/web/20141101125053/http:/typophile.com/wiki/London) studio, Research Associates.

Some of his early design work was for British bands. Fetish, Hanibal, 23 Skiddo, and Cabaret Voltaire all have album covers designed by Brody.

See a collection of his designs for the Dutch postal service [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20141101125053/http:/www.katranpress.com/stamps_brody_1_1.html).
author: Christopher Hall
